comments: A013597 and A092131 use different definitions of "nextprime(2)", namely A151800 vs A007918: A013597 assumes nextprime(2) = 3 = A151800(2), whereas A092131 assumes nextprime(2) = 2 = A007918(n). [Edited by _M. F. Hasler_, Sep 09 2015]If (for n>0) a(n)=1, then n is a power of 2 and 2^n+1 is a Fermat prime. n=1,2,4,8,16 are probably the only indices with this property. - _Franz Vrabec_, Sep 27 2005
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n=0..5000
author: James Kilfiger (mapdn(AT)csv.warwick.ac.uk)
